page.title: 04Geology of Papa Stour
page.content: Shetland is very diverse geologically and {Papa Stour}is no exception.The thing that strikes most visitors is the impressive{red}sea cliffs.The caves that occur in the cliffs are second only to Fingal's cave in the Hebrides.These caves can only be seen by boat,they are not otherwise access ible. Papa Stour is of {volcanic}origin. Geologists think we were formed by a volcanic eruption in{Ashea Ness}to the North.The base rock is Basalt and outcrops of this are found with gas holes full of interesting minerals. On the East side of Papa Stour sandy beaches are to be found but the West side is dominated by cliffs.We cover an area of 3 square miles but with such an indented coastline that the perimeter is 24 miles,and encompasses many sheltered inlets.
